data.title: Bing Crosby Theater
data.meta_description: The Bing Crosby Theater is Spokane’s theater for exceptional performances since 1915. See our Coming Events. Updated when events are booked.
data.text:
08.03 | 7:30PM

Known for his comedic prowess and clever wit, the Texas Original, William Lee Martin has carved a unique niche in the comedy world, and he’s poised to deliver a night of entertainment that's not only funny but also good for the soul. More>

09.05 | 7:00PM

Get ready to laugh like never before with Nate Jackson's Super Funny World Tour! As one of the freshest and most dynamic voices in comedy today, Nate Jackson is bringing his unique brand of humor to Spokane. Known for his incredible crowd-work, this show is one not to be missed. More>

09.11 | 8:00PM

This show is an explosive celebration of the iconic music of Jimmy Buffett, featuring all of his greatest hits that will have you singing along and dancing in your seat. With a band that is as talented as it is passionate, you’ll be treated to a performance that captures the essence of Buffet’s music and the lifestyle it embodies. More>

09.20 | 7:30PM

PRINCE AGAIN: A TRIBUTE TO PRINCE pays homage to the legend, busting out all his top numbers with perfect dance moves and stagecraft. So, don your “Raspberry Beret” and get ready to party, revisiting memories and making new ones as this tribute re-creates the sensational spectacle that was PRINCE! More>

9.21 | 8:00PM

Paper Flowers “Remembering Fleetwood Mac” invites you along on a journey back through time. Our multi-media show is a musical feast for the senses; it is an experience like no other, as we pay homage to the iconic and influential music of Fleetwood Mac. More>

09.22 | 2:00PM

Michael Sheen plays Nye Bevan in a surreal and spectacular journey through the life and legacy of the man who created Britain’s National Health Service. Facing the end of his life, Aneurin ‘Nye’ Bevan’s deepest memories lead him on a mind-bending journey from childhood to Parliament and fights with Churchill. More>

10.03 | 7:30PM

STAYIN’ ALIVE offers audiences the songs and sights of a full Bee Gees playlist, singing blockbusters such as “Night Fever”, “Jive Talkin’”, “How Deep Is Your Love”, “You Should Be Dancing”, “Nights on Broadway” and “Stayin’ Alive”. They perform softer poetic ballads such as “I Started a Joke”, “Massachusetts”, “Fanny Be Tender”, “Words” and “To Love Somebody” among other great hits. More>

10.20 | 2:00PM

Joseph Fiennes plays Gareth Southgate who has the worst track record for penalties in the world. This gripping examination of nation and game asks why the country that gave the world football has since delivered a painful pattern of loss. Why can’t England’s men win at their own game? More>

11.10 | 2:00PM

Tessa, played by Jodie Comer (Killing Eve), has worked her way up to be a criminal defense barrister at the top of her game. However, an unexpected event forces her to confront the lines where patriarchal power, burden of proof, and morals diverge. More >

11.19 | 7:30PM

PLEASE NOTE: This show has been rescheduled to Nov. 19th.

With hits like "Both Sides Now," "Send in the Clowns," and "Someday Soon," Judy Collins has created an enduring mark on the world of music. Her landmark 1967 album, Wildflowers, has been entered into the Grammy Hall of Fame. Now, almost sixty years later and an octogenarian, Collins released her first studio album, Spellbound, that has all original material and marks the first time she wrote all the songs on one of her albums. More>

12.08 | 5:00PM

From studio to stage, comedian Kat Timpf is taking her I USED TO LIKE YOU TOUR on the road in a hilarious live show experience that will leave you wanting more. Ripped from the pages of her new book, Kat takes the audience on a deep dive through her notoriously whacky stories, outrageous misadventures, and the colorful cast of characters she’s met along the way. More>

12.13 | 7:30PM

The Fab Four 2024 tour brings their all-new show to the stage, celebrating The Beatles’ first visit to the USA, with performances from the Ed Sullivan show, the Meet The Beatles album, as well as the Beatles’ greatest hits from every era. More>

The Bing Cosby Theater in downtown Spokane is full of local history. From starting out with silent movies, to Bing Crosby’s start, to today’s fantastic performances from well know stars to the local boys and girls of Spokane. I feel truly blessed to meet the Manger of the Theater while peeking in the windows to try to get a view of history. After speaking with her, it was easy to understand that her enthusiasm for the theater spills over to everyone she comes in contact with. They were getting the theater ready for night’s performance , but she took the time for a short tour. All I can say is [holy] cow. It’s truly beautiful and the acoustics are out of this world.

— Pat Akins
